Came across this game a couple of months ago and hit a bone that was close to the surface several decades ago. Back in the 60's & 70's (70's mostly) I built rocket kits, sometimes designing my own rockets. The last rocket I designed/built was 8' tall including lander. I had too much effort built into this just to send it a few hundred feet up, nor to loose it to winds aloft with the chutes. So this is what I built...

At it's heart, was a very rudimentary alt transmitter, and a model plane receiver for 1 top of ark servo action and 1 lower altitude action. At it's peak altitude, 3 black powder charges would be ignited to; 1) The lightest charge, push rocket body chutes out 4 ducted 3/4" thick fins of the main stage. 2) This, the largest charge, was in a re-enforced section below the slip-fitted lander, with the propellant in a honeycomb setup so it wouldn't "pool" into a pile or away from the igniter, push out the lander. 3) Placed in a tube atop the lander would push away from the lander while expelling a small drogue chute tethered to the lander to keep it upright while keeping it from gaining too much speed, but not too slow to insure that it kept relatively close to the launch area.

One C engine was mounted at the center of the lander so at several hundred feet from the ground it was ignited to provide a quick speed reduction & to blow out the main chutes. To keep battery weight down I took apart a mechanical flashbulb of the era to ignite the engine. The lander had gear that pivoted out when ejected from the main body of the rocket and a sprung, inward bending knee hinge to absorb what the chutes left for them.

That was nearly 40 years ago and my last venture into rocket designing, till now. Glad to be here!

Hi,

I'm Splat (not .Splat, that's just a name). I've been playing KSP since just before the release of .19. This game is awesome, like it's really, really neat. Once it's finished, it will be excellent.

So, I've been to Orbit, Mun, Minmus, Eve, Duna and that's it. I've been back from the Mun on just RCS fuel (and crashed shortly afterwards due to a lack of parachute)! And that's almost it.

I love spaceplanes, except for the 'space' part, I've never built a functioning SSTO.

That's it for now from me!

Found the KSP demo a bit over a month ago so I have no history with anything other than .2x. Bought it a week later. There was really no choice, was there?

Spent a few weeks building, sending up probes and ships, practicing my docking, establishing a station.

When I found the mods, I tried many but settled on just a few: lazor docking, flight engineer, crew transfer, and chatter. No automation.

Only two Kerbinauts have lost their lives, and that was on the pad. Rather than abort missions, I've sent rescue ships and refuelling tugs and brought every Kerbinaut home since.

My first Munshot was a success (if you don't include the Kerbinaut left in EVA orbit while a rescue mission was launched).

I'm now planning to reach further, establishing fuel depots so that I don't need to build massive multi-part vehicles that might kill my frame-rate.

And I'm regularly playing this instead of GTAV. Not sure what that says but there ya go.
